title: About Respiratory Illnesses
content:
What to do when you are sick
CDC
recommends
you stay home and away from others until at least 24 hours after both your symptoms are getting better overall, and you have not had a fever (and are not using fever-reducing medication). Resume normal activities and use added prevention strategies over the next five days.
